column1: The hamlet of Centereach was first called West Middle Island
column2: but primarily became known as New Village until the early 20th century.  When it was discovered that another town shared the same name in Upstate New York
column3: the name was changed to Centereach in 1916. The name Centereach reflects the centrality of the hamlet's location on Long Island
column4: literally meaning "center reached".Over the years Centereach has progressed from a small hamlet to a primarily suburban community.  The population in 1940 was only 628
column5: but the area had grown to nearly 20
column6: 000 residents by 1970.The two earliest suburban developments
column8: were Dawn Estates and Eastwood Village.In 1998
column9: the first single-point urban interchange in New York State was opened in Centereach
column10: at Middle Country Road and Nicolls Road.Centereach
